intro: Cladothamnus bracteatus, commonly known as the bracteate wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, leathery leaves and clustered flowerheads are typical features of the genus Cladothamnus. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting biodiversity.
